resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

resource.title: Job Aid: Employee Guide to ePerformance

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Welcome to the ePerformance module for employees.

This course will teach how to use the ePerformance tool to update and view your annual performance appraisals.


You can jump to a specific section of this module by clicking the menu link at the top left of the screen to open then menu, and then selecting the slide you would like to view.

If you wish to view the closed captions for this training module, click the speech bubble icon at the bottom of the player.

We have added files relevant to this training under the Resources link.

At times during this training, we may ask you to click an object on the screen to trigger an action, or click the next button to advance the course.

If you'd like to take notes, please download and print this Course Companion.

Click next when you are ready to get started.

A performance appraisal is a regular review of an employee's job performance and overall contribution to UC Davis.

The annual employee performance appraisal is an important part of both performance management and employee career development.

The annual employee performance appraisal is completed in ePerformance, which is the performance management module of UCPath.

Here is how the ePerformance process works: The employee will receive an email that an appraisal document has been created and and then can access it on ePerformance to enter the self-evaluation. And then moves on to the goals tab to propose specific individual objectives.

The objectives include 2 standard objectives that are in almost all staff appraisals.

For professional development and the promotion of diversity, equity and inclusion.

When the supervisor receives the evaluation, they can then complete the appraisal.

Confirming training compliance, rating employee performance and various core competencies, establishing individual goals, entering overall comments, and selecting an overall performance rating.

Next, the supervisor and employee can meet to discuss the appraisal; and afterwards, the supervisor shares the appraisal with the employee in UCPath.

To complete the process, the employee reviews the appraisal, adds comments if desired, and acknowledges the appraisal using ePerformance tool.
When it becomes available, you will receive an automated email, like the one you see onscreen. Just click on that link, and it will launch UCPath and take you to the Performance work center.

As an alternative, you can access e performance via the UCPath Online Portal menu.

To do this, first, open a browser and type in ucpath.universityofcalifornia.edu.
Follow prompts to select UC Davis, enter CAS username and password, and follow the prompts for DUO authentication.
In the left menu, click the Performance Workcenter.

Then click My Current Performance Documents in the left menu, and you will see the Appraisal on the right with the link that you can click on to open the actual appraisal.

Please note that if your review cycle hasnt yet started, you will not have any documents I the Current Performance Documents screen.

Next, we are going to walk through the actual steps to take to do your self evaluation.

When you go into the appraisal, the self-evaluation page will open up, and then you click the Empl Self-Evaluation Tab.

On the right side of the screen, there is a box for you to enter in your information.

Here you want to type in accomplishments, goals achieved, and other key information.

If you prefer, you can write your appraisal in Word and then copy and paste it into the self-evaluation box.

For tips on writing a self-evaluation, check ou the Performance Appraisal website - its on-screen here and also available from the Resources section at the top of the page.

Please click next to continue.

As you work on your appraisal, be sure to save your work frequently by clicking the save button on the top right.

The system will time-out after 30 minutes of inactivity, so if you are stepping away, or doing some research for information to put in your appraisal, be sure to click save before you move away from this window.

The next step, after entering your overall self-evaluation, is to enter some specific future goals.

To do that, click the Future Goals tab.

For most staff appraisals, the first 2 goals will already be filled in for you.

Goal 1 is around Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, and Goal 2 is for Professional Development.

Goals 3 through 7 can be input based on your specific role.

If you are looking for tips on what to put into the 2 standard goals, check out the Performance Appraisal HR webpage that we mentioned earlier. It is available to you on the resources button at the top of the screen.

When you are done with your entries into the self-evaluation and future goals tab, you can then click complete to send the appraisal to your supervisor.

You dont need to enter anything into the employee comments at this point, but it will be available to you if you would like to enter something after the supervisor completes your appraisal.
When you click complete, a pop-up dialog box will appear - click Confirm.

Your supervisor will then complete your appraisal, adding Key Duties, Core Competencies, and entering ratings and comments. After your meeting to review the appraisal together, the Appraisal will also be shared with you in UCPath Online for your final review and acknowledgement.

a. Watch for email notification that the appraisal is ready for your review

b. Access the appraisal in UCPath Online (same steps as above, #1)

So lets take a look now at what you will see when your appraisal is sent back to you by your supervisor after its completed.

You will receive a notification that your appraisal is ready for your review, and you can click the link on the email to open it.

And then you can review the content by either clicking on each tab or by clicking Long Format that you see here to have all the information displayed on one screen.
If you would like to provide any comments or feedback on your appraisal, please enter it here. If you dont have any comments, you can leave this field empty.
When youre done with your review, click the Acknowledge button.

A pop-up dialog box will appear and then you can click confirm to finish your appraisal.

This completes the performance appraisal process.

Once an appraisal has been completed you can return to ePerformance to view it.

Simply navigate to My Historical Performance Docs in the left menu and select the appraisal you wish to review.

Please keep in mind that appraisals were not converted to ePerformance from legacy systems. Historic documents completed before 2020 need to be obtained from the legacy EPAR system for Davis campus employees or from the legacy PeopleSoft system at Health.

Please click next to continue.

This concludes this course. For more information on Performance Appraisals at UC Davis, please visit the HR web page shown on-screen.

For job aids or to listen to webinar recordings, please visit the UCPath Training web page.

If you need technical support with your appraisal, please email workforcestrategies@ucdavis.edu .
